meanings.sent1: Farming requires a lot of labor in the fields.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers put in long hours of labor to build the house.
meanings.sent3: The ant carried a heavy leaf, showing great labor for such a tiny creature.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece was a result of years of labor and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The miners emerged from the cave covered in dirt and sweat from their labor.

meanings.sent1: The doctor assisted the mother during her labor in the delivery room.
meanings.sent2: The midwife helped the woman through a long and difficult labor.
meanings.sent3: The baby seemed to be in no rush to start the labor of being born.
meanings.sent4: The labor pains were intense, but the mother knew it meant her baby was coming soon.
meanings.sent5: The hospital staff prepared the room for the upcoming labor of a new life entering the world.

meanings.definition: To work hard; to make great effort.
meanings.sent1: She had to labor all night to finish the project before the deadline.
meanings.sent2: The team continued to labor despite the challenges they faced.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel labored to carry the acorn up the tall tree.
meanings.sent4: He labored over his decision, weighing the pros and cons carefully.
meanings.sent5: The students labored through the exam, determined to do their best.
